result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
James Fassbender, ADA present.
Attorney Troy Nielsen present.
Defendant present.
Per ADA Fassbender - State has completed witness responsibility.
Per ADA Fassbender - moves to dismiss and read-in 15CM53.
Per ADA Fassbender and Attorney Nielsen - stip to hold restitution open at this time.
Statements by ADA Fassbender.
Statements by ATtorney Nielsen.
Court orders sentence withheld - probation 3 years concurrent.
Conditions of probation:
Pay costs - work out payment plan with Agent.
Supervision fees.
Submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations.
Shall not consume any illegal substances, absent valid prescriptions authorized by healthcare provider.
Absolute sobriety.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or pursue schooling.
Supply a biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
14CF287 - Jail - 9 months - stay 3 months.
To begin 5/1/15 at 6:00 p.m.
64 days credit if revoked.
14CF176 - 6 months jail - all stayed.
8 days credit if revoked.
Granted huber privileges.
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Initial appearance on April 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
